speaker: DR COUVILLION
line: It's important that you realize sonograms are by no means an exact science. I don't want to alarm you or have you jump to conclusions because honestly, it's not something that we're perfectly able to explain.

speaker: LAURA
line: But I-I don't see anything.

speaker: DR COUVILLION
line: As I said, we may be premature in a diagnosis. It may simply be... An intermediate stage of growth.

speaker: WAYNE
line: But there's a problem.

speaker: DR COUVILLION
line: We see a development-- an abnormal bony formation involving the upper vertebrae and something growing here-- on the plates of the skull.

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne...

speaker: WAYNE
line: Sweetness?

speaker: LAURA
line: It might be nothing. I'm serious. Dr. Couvillion really just wants to wait and see.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I just... want it to be normal.

speaker: LAURA
line: Oh, Wayne... let's go home, okay? Come on.

speaker: LAURA
line: Thank you.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I love you, Laura... no matter what. You know that? Poopydoo?

speaker: LAURA
line: I know. Good night, Wayne.

speaker: WAYNE
line: Good night, Laura. Sweet dreams.

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne!

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne!

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne! Please, what are you doing?! No...

speaker: LAURA
line: Stop it! Wayne! Where are you?! Stop him!

speaker: LAURA
line: Please, don't take my baby! Please, don't take my baby! Wayne! Wayne!

speaker: WAYNE
line: Laura?

speaker: LAURA
line: My baby!

speaker: WAYNE
line: Laura, it's okay. Laurie, you're having a dream.

speaker: LAURA
line: Oh, it was terrible.

speaker: WAYNE
line: It's okay. Shh.

speaker: LAURA
line: Oh... it was... Trying to steal our baby.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: It's not the kind of case where I quite know where to turn, you understand. Down in Hollins we do get our share of the oddball. On the whole, though, we're pretty much like any other little town. You got your home break-ins, your smash and grabs... nothing too wild. But given the victim's statement, the unusually vivid detail... Well, I just had to take Laura's word about her baby being abducted. I hear you specialize in these kind of cases.

speaker: AGENT SPENDER
line: You've come to the right place, Deputy, uh... Stevens. Now this woman making these claims she's your sister?

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Yes, sir. Laura Weinsider.

speaker: AGENT SPENDER
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: I've heard about the things people been saying about her, not to my face, of course, but... real mean and awful things about what Laura's part is in all this.

speaker: AGENT SPENDER
line: Now it says here, a doctor's report the day before revealed to her ah... abnormalities in the ultrasound.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Yes, sir, that is true, but nothing conclusive, mind you.

speaker: AGENT SPENDER
line: I see. Okay, Deputy. We're going to put this right into our priority caseload.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Boy... I really want to thank you. I know Laura's really itching to talk to somebody who will really listen to her.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: I know this went right into your caseload but I never imagined you would get here so soon, Agent, uh...

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, Mulder. Fox Mulder. Though I ask you not to make that known to anybody. The FBI likes to keep our work on these cases very hush-hush.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Sure, of course but I would like to thank Agent Spender.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh. No, no, no. I'll thank him for you because I have to call in my, uh, progress report.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: I hope you have something to call in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, me, too. All right.

speaker: LAURA
line: I kept calling it a nightmare... But how many people's nightmare's come true?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not many. Certainly not in the way yours did, Mrs. Weinsider.

speaker: LAURA
line: When I was having it... it just seemed so real.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mentioned a fire in the room, in your account and a, uh... a devil that held your legs...

speaker: LAURA
line: So that he could take the baby.

speaker: MULDER
line: But according to your statement â€¦ your baby... was not a normal baby.

speaker: LAURA
line: No. It was some kind of monster. With, um...horns and a tail. Can you excuse me?

speaker: WAYNE
line: My wife appears so resilient, but I know she's suffered ever since the doctor told us about the complications.

speaker: MULDER
line: Um... You were right there in bed with your wife the whole time Mr. Weinsider?

speaker: WAYNE
line: Yes. I woke her up.

speaker: MULDER
line: But according to... your wife's statement, at one point she... she reached over for you in the bed and you weren't there.

speaker: WAYNE
line: Well, it was a dream.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Mind if I use your phone... Wayne?

speaker: WAYNE

speaker: SCULLY
line: Remember your truthfulness is important, Mr. Ginsberg and as a prospective federal employee, I will remind you to answer as honestly as possible. Okay?

line: Hey, Scully, it's me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where are you? I waited 45 minutes for you this morning.

line: Call it what you like. Here in Roanoke they're calling it a demon baby snatching.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I want you to look at this woman's charts. Strange in utero deformities were detected. I'm going to courier them to you, all right?

speaker: SCULLY

line: Scully, Spender just round filed this case-- it's unconscionable.

speaker: MULDER

speaker: SCULLY
line: "We," Mulder? I'm stuck with it. You're not here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, this is a classic case of demon fetal harvest- what they called in the middle ages atum nocturnem-- the impregnation of an unwitting woman by a dark lord of the underworld...

speaker: SCULLY

line: Exactly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw Rosemary's Baby on cable the other night.

speaker: MULDER

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER

speaker: MULDER

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think I found what you're looking for. I've been up all night going over the medical charts on the Weinsider baby.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd you find?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The prenatal birth defects that you spoke of? They're all here, but they're subtle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Describe them to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they look to be discrete bony deformities. There are spurs on the superior aspect of the scapula and small protuberances on the skull adjacent to the coronal suture.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Protuberances?" You mean, like horns?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they could be recessive characteristics expressed as vestiges of primitive morphology or a developmental anomaly like craniosynostosis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think this is something that could be passed along by the father?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I wouldn't look to the father as any kind of dark force here, Mulder. I think it's the mother and Virginia law on third- trimester abortions requires you to put her under arrest.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Labor was induced, Mulder. In the mother's blood, there was found a significant trace of an herb called mandrake. It's a poison that's been known to facilitate self-abortion.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Mandrake?"

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's also been known to be used as an hallucinogenic.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think Mrs. Weinsider self-prescribed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I called the doctor on a hunch and he said that the father was very upset about the news while the mother was quite the opposite. Look, Mulder, I'm going to fax this information to you so that you can present it to the commonwealth attorney for the county of Roanoke but I think we have your baby snatcher here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah? What? Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I suggest that you proceed very carefully. This could be very emotional for everybody concerned.

line: All right, thank you.

line: Honey... I wouldn't let anything happen not to our little bundle of joy.

line: I'll tell you who's been taking hallucinogenics. She didn't take poison. My sister had never even heard of... whatever it is.

line: Mandrake.

line: Who's accusing you?

line: Who do you think? I don't know where you been, Wayne but I'm the only one keeping the dogs from the door.

line: Well, a man's got to make a living.

line: Wayne-- Mr. Weinsider-I-I don't want to arrest Laura. I'm sure you'd hate like the devil for that to happen as well.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I should say so.

speaker: MULDER
line: So why don't you tell Deputy Stevens that it's okay to search the premises so we can clear up any misunderstanding about who's responsible for what happened here?

speaker: WAYNE
line: Of course.

line: Laura, could you come here?

line: Whatever else we find I know everybody in this house is regular.

line: I know there's nothing they're going to find but why do I feel guilty anyway?

line: Laura, there's something I need to tell you about that... Something that I've kept secret for reasons that I think will explain for themselves.

line: What? What are you talking about?

line: Well, I don't exactly know how to say this. I'm sure that you might find it painful, as I do.

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne, what?

speaker: WAYNE
line: On the night... the night that you lost the baby I had gotten up because I couldn't sleep and when I came back to bed, you were... you had... our little baby in your hands. You were in some kind of trance. I couldn't get you to wake up. You keep chanting over and over "zazas, zazas, nastanada zazas and..."

speaker: LAURA
line: Wayne...

speaker: WAYNE
line: All I could do was take our little boy, our little baby and wrap him up so I could make sure that no one could ever learn the truth.

speaker: LAURA
line: Oh, my god.

line: And the other night when you saw me outside... when I was burning the leaves?

speaker: LAURA
line: No! No.

speaker: WAYNE
line: Laura, I was just doing it to protect you. I knew that I could never bring back our little boy, our precious little Wayne, Junior but I couldn't bear losing you.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Hey! Take a look at this!

speaker: LAURA
line: I don't know what to tell you. All I can think... when they told me that something was wrong... that there was a problem, was that this thing that was growing inside me was evil. I kept thinking that maybe it was something I did wrong and that this was my punishment. I told Wayne that everything was going to be okay... but I lied, but you have to believe me, Arky! I didn't mean to kill it. I didn't know what I was doing. It was the herbal medication. That's all I can think.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Laura, Laura... I don't think you should say any more. I'm going to have to read you your rights. We're going to have to go down to the station and do all that. I'm sorry.

speaker: WAYNE
line: You're going to be okay. I'm going to get the best attorney.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know what you are.

speaker: RADIO
line: I'm only happy when it rains I'm only happy when it's complicated And though I know you can't appreciate it I'm only happy when it rains...

line: Hi, Betsy, it's me.

line: Wayne, where are you?

line: I'm on my way.

line: I want to be there, honey. I don't want to be the kind of husband who isn't there every step of the way.

speaker: BETSY
line: You've already missed a lot of steps. Anyway, it's just a sonogram.

line: Wayne, what have you been smoking?

line: I'm three blocks away, Betsy. I'm going to be pulling up in front of the house in less than five minutes.

line: Wayne.

line: I'm late for an appointment.

speaker: WAYNE
line: A business client.

speaker: BETSY
line: Wayne, I'm hanging up now.

line: Right, you're in the insurance business. That must take you out on the road an awful lot, huh?

line: It's for next Tuesday.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I know that, Kim. Can I call you Kim? I was in the neighborhood and... well, insurance isn't something you want to be without, even for just a week.

line: What do you do with that?

speaker: WAYNE
line: Oh, they check it out, make sure you're not a policy risk.

speaker: MS BRITTON
line: Slow down, monsters.

line: Those your kids?

speaker: MS BRITTON
line: Why, yes.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I love kids. Got a baby on the way myself. Seems like I've been trying forever. Hold that. Those are fine-looking boys. You don't know how lucky you are. Two cells, with all that can go wrong, and there they are...perfect.

line: Mulder...Mulder, I have to tell him something. What do you want me to say?

line: I got a message you needed to see me, Laura. What is it?

speaker: LAURA

line: Well, I've been meeting with attorneys and... given the circumstances and your emotional state they feel confident of an acquittal if that's what you're worried about, Laura.

line: Laura, can you hear me? Laura, can you hear me?

line: The doctor found something. She doesn't know yet but there's some kind of bony growths on the baby's spine and skull. It may just be a stage of development. She really just wants to wait and see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you asked me to come down here and then you're nowhere to be found.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was down in the basement at county records doing a background check.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... It's me. That's your cover story, remember?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's where I was. I was piecing together the history of the man that did this to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's why I was looking for you because, in fact, nobody did anything to her. Mulder, there is absolutely no evidence of bodily injury of overdose, of suffocation, of anything that would explain why she was in a coma.

speaker: MULDER
line: Perfect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder, I don't think you heard what I said. I did a complete medical review, just as you asked. What I'm saying is that there is not a shred of evidence to implicate the husband or anyone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not a shred of evidence is exactly the evidence I'd hoped you'd find. Check this out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ivan Veles, born Czechoslovakia in 1956. Married twice, widowed twice, no children. Prosecuted twice for murder of wives Gisele and Helga. Acquitted twice on lack of evidence. Who is Ivan Veles?

speaker: MULDER
line: Wayne Weinsider. He's a Czech national, emigrated in 1994. He's also known as Bud Hasselhoff, also known as Gordy Boitano.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gordy Boitano.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's more. Read on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In Slavic societies the name Veles was synonymous with... the Devil. From the Lithuanian root "Vele"-- a horned demon who sucks the souls of the innocent. Mulder, you're not suggesting that he is himself... a devil, are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not suggesting anything. I think the facts speak for themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I will accept that a man can be demonic that he may have demon-like attributes but why would a demon-- if there were such a thing--

line: 00-to-5:00 make room for daddy routine just so he can off his wife and unborn child?

line: You're going to find discrete osteopathic deformities to the upper vertebrae, two bony protrusions between the parietal and occipital lobes of the skull.

line: He's done this to other women here, Scully just like in Czechoslovakia. My guess is that baby we just dug up belonged to one of Wayne's other wives.

line: What are you saying, that he's trying to propagate? He's trying to breed?

line: He's exercising his biological imperative and he'll do anything or say anything he has to to succeed.

line: But it doesn't make sense, Mulder. If he's trying to breed then why would he be snatching his own babies and burying them in his backyard?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because they're demons and he wants a normal child.

speaker: BETSY
line: No! No! Wayne! Wayne! What are you doing?!

line: Maybe you didn't hear me! I said, what are you doing, Wayne?

line: 15527 Leahy. That's in Cave Spring. It's West Roanoke. Cave Spring. Thank you. Thank you very much for your help.

line: Mulder, where are we going?

line: Harmony Mutual Insurance has a second address for Wayne Weinsider all the way across the other side of Roanoke County.

line: Do you think he's got a second wife?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, think about it, Scully. He meets or screens prospective women through work. That's probably why he came to this country in the first place-- bigger gene pool more women-- then he plants as many seeds as he can. Let's just hope he hasn't been able to harvest many more of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: BETSY
line: Please! Please. He took my baby! He took my baby!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay, ma'am.

speaker: BETSY
line: Wayne. Wayne. He took my baby.

speaker: TELEVISION
line: nan

speaker: MAN
line: How are you, sweetheart?

speaker: CHILD
line: Is he going to die?

speaker: MAN
line: Of course not. People don't die from chicken pox.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Did you ever have chicken pox?

speaker: MAN
line: I've had everything. How about you?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I've been trying to remember.

speaker: MAN
line: You won't have to try long. You'll know in a day or two.

speaker: WOMAN
line: That's what's worrying me. You can go on down. I'll be down in a minute.

speaker: CHILD
line: I bet she's going to die.

speaker: MAN
line: Will you stop talking like that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Wayne! It's over.

speaker: WAYNE
line: A normal life. A family. That's all I ever wanted.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's the baby, Wayne?

speaker: WAYNE
line: How could she do this to them?

speaker: MULDER
line: Put the shovel down. Your lies won't work anymore.

speaker: WAYNE
line: My lies? What about her lies?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whatever the truth, Mr. Weinsider you can't hope to bury it now.

speaker: WAYNE
line: I'm not burying anything. I'm digging it up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's the baby?

speaker: WAYNE
line: Don't you understand? She took it. Betsy took it!

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't blame anyone else like you did with Laura.

speaker: WAYNE
line: Don't you see? Betsy isn't like Laura. Betsy is...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get the paramedics!

speaker: WAYNE
line: I just wanted what everyone wants.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Hey! Don't even think about it! You put that guy someplace else! I don't want him in sight of my sister.

speaker: NURSE
line: Sir, he just got out of surgery.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Give me this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, cut it out! Come on. You're in enough trouble as it is. You don't want to complicate your situation further by endangering his life again, do you?

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: That son of a bitch better live so I can beat the truth out of him. Find out why he did it... and how the hell he did it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think the why is directly related to the how.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: What do you mean? What do you mean by that?

speaker: MULDER
line: We should just go talk to this other wife of his. This woman Betsy. Come on.

speaker: DEPUTY ARKY STEVENS
line: Wait a minute.

speaker: NURSE
line: Mrs. Weinsider?

speaker: NURSE 2
line: Flat line.

speaker: NURSE
line: I can't believe it. Page Dr. Nyland up here. Just breathe deep, Mrs. Weinsider. Can you breathe for me?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Going to get a couple of more shots over here.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Four total. All here for some time. Maybe years. All normal, though, Mulder. No osteological deformities. And Betsy's baby isn't here. There are no fresh graves.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think he did with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think he did anything with it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But she was recently pregnant. I mean, I-I saw her records. There are sonograms in the house. Showing the same defects.

speaker: MULDER
line: These weren't Wayne's babies, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whose babies were they?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think Wayne realized something last night. That's why he was out here digging. He realized that he'd met someone even more evil than he was-- who would sacrifice what he desperately wanted for himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Betsy?

speaker: MULDER
line: It was no coincidence that she ran into us last night. We were taken in by her just like Wayne was-- by a woman who would say anything or do anything to get what she wanted-- who was even more driven than he was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: to what?

speaker: MULDER
line: To have what only Wayne could give her.

speaker: RADIO
line: I'm only happy when it rains You know I love it when the news is bad Why I feel so good to feel so sad I'm only happy when it rains Pour your misery down Pour your misery down on me Pour your misery down Pour your misery down on me...
